name: InterContinental Thalasso-Spa Bora Bora

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the IC Bora Bora from October 9th through October 18th and we had the most unbelievable time. We flew from Boston and from when we left our apartment in the city until we arrived at the IC, it took 24 hours and we were absolutely exhausted. When we arrived there, they took all of the couples into the main lobby and sat us each at separate tables and gave us a refreshing drink and a light snack as we began the check-in process. Within two minutes someone was at our table, greeted us by name, and started to run through our check-in. Because we were Ambassador members with the IC chain, we were able to get into our room right away (at 9:30am) and immediately unpacked and slipped into our bathrobes and started to enjoy our stay. Here are some highlights and tips:
reviews.title: Absolute Heaven

likes.disliked: — How long it took to get there!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: * I'm sure any bungalow you stay in on the property is wonderful. We stayed in a Diamond room - room 233 - and really enjoyed being that far out into the water. The water was about 8 feet deep so we could dive off of our deck and just float around in our tubes for hours. There weren't many fish which was perfect for our taste, but every day at around 5pm we saw a different ray come swimming by. As we walked by some of the other bungalows, we saw people standing in the water, waist high, swimming around but we really enjoyed the freedom of having the depth of the ocean where we were.
reviews.title: Great Honeymoon Spot

likes.liked: — The Spa, The room, activities and the pool.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: *Our view from the Diamond was perfect, we looked straight at the mountain and saw the most amazing sunsets every single night... that added so much to our experience.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort, Food Needs Some Help....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: *The bungalows are HUGE! It was the perfect amount of space. Also, the decks are great, perfect sunning lounge chairs, fresh water rinse after going into the salt water, we spent 75% of our time on the deck just hanging out looking at the water and soaking up the sun. Each bungalow was spaced really well to the next one so it didn't feel like you were too close to your neighbors.
reviews.title: Paradise is the Thalasso

likes.disliked: — The sand was still a bit slimy from construction

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: *The spa is absolutely wonderful. We went there for a 90 minute massage in the same room the day after we got there and it immediately put us straight into the relaxation mode we were looking for. We went back there half way through the trip and did a 30 minute massage which was just as nice. As other people have said, arrive there early and stay late to use their spa's and hang out. It's a really cool place.
reviews.title: Wonderful place, quiet, luxurious, pricey.

likes.disliked: — Isolated, sand still dirty from construction

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our expectations were continuously exceeded, from the moment we arrived to the saddest moment of our trip when we had to depart our little island paradise. On a scale of 1 to 10, this place and its staff are a 15 million. We had organized our trip earlier this year and planned our wedding on the resorts beach facing Mt. Otemanu. Everything was stunning, from our wonderful Diamond OWB to the Tahitian wedding ceremony to the shark diving and the visits to Viatape. Meal plan was great, allowing for flexibility between the two resorts. One of the best things was watching our private fish tank from the deck of our bungalow. We saw plenty of fish and rays, we even saw a few sharks! Our concierge, M. Jerome Palacoeur, made us feel so welcome and all of his staff(spa staff, wait staff, boat crew, housekeeping, dive master Ben, wedding coordinator, ceremony vahines, ceremony warriors, ceremony musicians, ceremony chief/priest, photographer, front desk staff and assisting concierge staff) made this experience one we will cherish for the rest of our lives. We hope to return in the near future!
reviews.title: Paradise Found...

likes.liked: — The excellent personal service we were given.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from my honeymoon 5 nights at Thalasso and 4 nights on Huahine. We had the same experience as the last few reviewers. the rooms are gorgeous and immaculate, large and full of luxuries as others have described and shown in the photos. Overall the service was excellent except in the restaurant.
reviews.title: gorgeous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our check-in took 30 minutes but 7 couples all arrived at basically the same time but they had 4 people helping so it went fine. Still seems long but they make you very comfortable and the view is tremendous. We had a bungalow at the end which was great, be prepared for long walks because it was a quarter mile for us to walk to dinner.
reviews.title: Great Place to Honeymoon

reviews.text: Water is clear and gorgeous, we did see quite a bit of sea life around the bungalow but certainly not what would have been if there was coral but there are other places to see that.
reviews.title: Paradise in Bora Bora!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort is very quiet and isolated which is wonderful and the boat will take you to the main island if you want.
reviews.title: A beautifully designed resort!

likes.liked: — The design of the resort, views, lagoon, bungalows

aka: Intercontinental Thalasso-Spa Bora Bora Hotel Bora Bora
description: InterContinental Bora Bora Resort & Thalasso Spa is located between the two hearts of Motu Piti Aau, a coral island on the barrier reef. The Deep Ocean Spa is the centerpiece, but the resort offers lots of cultural and recreational activities to fill your days including canoeing, kayaking, snorkeling, stargazing and handicraft demonstrations.
